results.text: The slang term you were sure you understood just so happens to have an alternative or offensive meaning that you were unaware of. Locals refuse to talk to you about the topic until you improve their attitude towards you.
You accidentally misattribute something of importance to a rival politician, guild, or other major organization. Locals purposefully misdirect you around town for the next 24 hours.
You commit a breach of etiquette, deeply offending someone or a group of individuals. You have disadvantage on your next Culture check.
You misuse a custom, offending the locals. Their attitude towards you decreases by one step.
A tradegood you thought would be a surefire hit with the locals is either illegal or is tied to a regional superstition. Merchants offer you worse prices on goods and services.
The locals provide you a name for a point of interest, but really it’s just a red herring. You waste a day fruitlessly searching.
